cluster_relations.rel_desc: The caterpillar forms the chrysalis, a protective shell around itself.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: An organism or biological process constructs or forms a new anatomical or protective structure (e.g., a caterpillar forming a chrysalis) as part of its development.

qualifiers.ConditionExpression: when it stops eating and prepares for the next stage

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Butterfly wings are formed as new tissues during metamorphosis.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: A developmental process (such as metamorphosis) produces or develops a new anatomical structure (e.g., wings, antennae).

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Antennae are among the new structures that form during metamorphosis.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: A developmental process (such as metamorphosis) produces or develops a new anatomical structure (e.g., wings, antennae).

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The chrysalis is the structure from which the adult butterfly (adult stage) emerges.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: A life-cycle structure or stage gives rise to or transitions into the subsequent life-cycle stage (e.g., chrysalis to adult butterfly stage).
remarks: Adult stage is represented via the adult butterfly stage entity.
Adult stage is represented via the adult butterfly stage entity.
Adult stage is represented via the adult butterfly stage entity.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Fluid is pumped into the butterfly wings to make them expand and harden.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Subject fluid fills the internal structure or cavity of the object, typically to enable its expansion or functional development.

args.canonical_rel_desc: A developing organism or developmental process generates or forms a new anatomical or protective structure (e.g., a caterpillar forming a chrysalis, metamorphosis forming wings or antennae).
args.justification: All three relations describe developmental processes that causally produce new anatomical or protective structures. They should share a single canonical predicate and relation class for morphogenetic formation, rather than split between 'forms_structure' and 'develops_structure' and two slightly different formation-class labels.

args.canonical_rel_desc: A life-cycle structure or stage transitions into a subsequent life-cycle stage (e.g., chrysalis transitioning to the adult butterfly stage).
args.justification: The relation describes a temporal life-cycle transition from one distinct stage to another. 'Transitions_to_life_stage' is a clearer and more standard predicate than 'gives_rise_to_stage' while preserving the same life-cycle transition class and temporal grouping.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: A developing organism or developmental process generates or forms a new anatomical or protective structure (e.g., a caterpillar forming a chrysalis, metamorphosis forming wings or antennae).
executed_decisions.justification: All three relations describe developmental processes that causally produce new anatomical or protective structures. They should share a single canonical predicate and relation class for morphogenetic formation, rather than split between 'forms_structure' and 'develops_structure' and two slightly different formation-class labels.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: A life-cycle structure or stage transitions into a subsequent life-cycle stage (e.g., chrysalis transitioning to the adult butterfly stage).
executed_decisions.justification: The relation describes a temporal life-cycle transition from one distinct stage to another. 'Transitions_to_life_stage' is a clearer and more standard predicate than 'gives_rise_to_stage' while preserving the same life-cycle transition class and temporal grouping.
